decision_conditions: <p>The brickwork used in the extension hereby approved shall match that of the host building and the hereby approved windows and doors shall be of timber construction.&nbsp;</p><p>REASON: To safeguard the character and appearance of the host building and conservation area.&nbsp;</p>

<p>The two outbuildings labelled 'Timber Sukkah' on Plan No. OR.33.EX.101 shall be demolished in full prior to the commencement of the extension hereby approved.&nbsp;</p><p>REASON: To protect the design character and appearance of the existing host building and conservation area.<br></p>

<p>Prior to superstructure works, detailed specification, a drainage layout and a management &amp; maintenance plan (where applicable) of the water butt with overflow shall be submitted to, and approved by the LPA, in consultation with the LLFA. It must be demonstrated that there will be no increase in surface water flow being discharged offsite and an overall reduction in peak flow rate and volume.</p><p>REASON: To reduce the risk of surface water flooding.<br></p>

<p>Prior to commencement, other than demolition works, the applicant shall submit a flooding resilience report to the Local Planning Authority for approval. The report shall include:</p><ul><li>intrusive investigation/trial pit and monitoring where necessary</li><li>demonstrate that the basement development and lightwell will not increase the potential for groundwater flooding to itself or to the surrounding area</li><li>provide details of appropriate controls including flood resilience and/or resistance measures against surface water (overland flow) and groundwater (if identified)&nbsp;</li></ul><p>The basement shall be constructed and completed in accordance with the approved plans in line with BS 8102:2022 Protection of below ground structures against water ingress - code of practice. The development&nbsp;shall be completed in accordance with the approved details and maintained as such for the lifetime of the development.</p><p>REASON: To reduce the risk of surface water flooding.</p>

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
description: Demolition of existing structures, excavation to extend the existing basement with rear lightwell, the erection of a ground floor rear and side wraparound extension with sukkah roof, and front lightwell.
